description: Google is urging officials at President Donald Trump’s Justice Department to back away from a push to break up the search engine company, citing national security concerns, according to people familiar with the discussions.
title: Google Urges Trump DOJ to Reverse Course on Breaking Up Company

description: US officials are rushing to revive a mineral-resources deal with Ukraine, with the goal of President Donald Trump announcing an agreement as soon as his speech to Congress on Tuesday night, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Trump Team Optimistic About Minerals Deal After Zelenskiy Pledge

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Bloomberg Businessweek national correspondent Joshua Green previews the president’s address to Congress tonight. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Delivers Address as Economic Uncertainty Looms in Background

description: Chile Interior Minister Carolina Toha stepped down from her post, marking the clearest sign yet that she intends to compete for the center-left in this year’s presidential election.
title: Chile Interior Minister Quits, Fueling Bets of Presidential Run

description: President Donald Trump has called for the US to retake control of the Panama Canal unless the cost of passage for naval and merchant ships is slashed. Trump’s refusal to rule out the use of force is a throwback to the 19th century era of gunboat diplomacy. While it remains unclear whether Trump is simply posturing, his demand has jolted Latin America, which is less afflicted by territorial disputes than regions such as the Middle East and Asia. It shows a willingness to flout treaties and anger
title: Trump Wants to ‘Take Back’ the Panama Canal. Why That’s Not So Simple

description: Israel’s defense policy has taken on a bold black-or-white approach following Hamas’ Oct. 7 attack and 15 subsequent months of war, Economy Minister Nir Barkat said, signaling the country won’t be willing to compromise security on any of its borders.
title: Israeli Minister Says Those Posing Threat Will End Up Like Gaza

description: The Trump administration is walking back a directive ordering federal agencies to cut probationary employees after a judge last week ordered a pause to the mass terminations.
title: Trump Administration Walks Back Firing Federal Workers After Ruling

description: Ukraine’s military can keep up the fight against Russian forces for at least a few more months despite President Donald Trump’s decision to pause US arms supplies, according to allied officials, but key munitions could begin to run short sooner.
title: Trump’s Pause in Arms for Ukraine to Hit War Effort in Months

description: The government’s list of “non-core” assets totals almost 80 million square feet of commercial space across 47 states, Washington DC and Puerto Rico.
title: Trump Seeks to Put 443 Federal Properties Up for Sale

description: There are many questions swirling around Washington and the crypto market regarding how exactly the Trump administration will attempt to execute on the president’s plan for a strategic cryptocurrency reserve.
title: Backlash to Crypto-Reserve Plan Raises Doubts on Its Prospects

description: Supply Lines is a daily newsletter that tracks global trade. Sign up here.
title: Mexico’s President Opts for Caution in Face of Trump Tariffs

description: Taiwan’s fall to China “would be a disaster for American interests” and the island’s government must raise defense spending to deter Beijing, Elbridge Colby, President Donald Trump’s pick to lead Pentagon policy, said Tuesday during his Senate confirmation hearing.
title: Fall of Taiwan Would Be ‘Disaster’ for US, Trump Pick Colby Says

description: The world’s supply lines for cargoes of oil and fuel, which typically criss-cross the globe, are about to get redrawn thanks to US President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs.
title: Trump’s Energy Tariffs Are Set to Spark a Redrawing of Oil Flows

description: The Democratic Republic of Congo has offered the US exclusive access to critical minerals and infrastructure projects in exchange for security assistance as it battles a rebellion backed by neighboring Rwanda.
title: Congo Courts Trump for Strategic Minerals Tie-Up as War Looms

description: Jessica Martinez, a breast cancer survivor who lives with multiple sclerosis and relies on Medicaid to pay for medication, will be sitting in the House gallery when President Donald Trump delivers his address to Congress Tuesday evening.
title: Democrats Invite Fired Park Rangers, Vets to Attend Trump Speech

description: US President Donald Trump has long said he would negotiate a quick end to Russia’s war in Ukraine. In pursuit of a deal, the US has engaged with the Kremlin while pressuring Kyiv to support the peace initiative.
title: What Trump’s Pause on US Military Aid Means for Ukraine

description: Germany will set up a €500 billion ($528 billion) fund as part of a sweeping policy overhaul to tackle urgently needed investments in defense and infrastructure, according to chancellor-in-waiting Friedrich Merz.
title: Germany Will Set Up €500 Billion Defense and Infrastructure Fund

description: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau dismissed another Biden-era lawsuit, this one targeting some of the world’s largest banks for allegedly rushing out a peer-to-peer payment network that then allowed fraud to proliferate.
title: CFPB Drops Lawsuit Against US Banks Over Alleged Fraud on Zelle

description: US President Donald Trump’s objective is to destroy Canada’s economy so he can annex the country, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said during a fiery news conference about the start of a trade war between the countries.
title: Trump’s Goal in Trade War Is to Annex Canada, Trudeau Says

description: Elon Musk will brief the House GOP at the Capitol Wednesday night on “the ongoing work of the Department of Government Efficiency,” according to two House Republicans.
title: Elon Musk to Brief House Republicans on DOGE Cuts as Local Backlash Grows

description: The president is vowing a tariff war with allies, steep cuts to the federal workforce and a tough stance on Ukraine aid.
title: Trump Addresses a Joint Session of Congress: What to Watch

description: The US Supreme Court signaled it’s likely to toss out a Mexican government lawsuit that accuses gunmakers including Smith & Wesson Brands Inc. of helping to funnel firearms to the country’s violent drug cartels.
title: Supreme Court Casts Doubt on Mexico’s Suit Against Gunmakers

description: The Associated Press renewed its request for a judge to order the White House to allow the wire service’s reporters to resume covering President Donald Trump’s events.
title: Associated Press Asks Court to Restore Full White House Access

description: President Donald Trump threatened to stop all federal funding for colleges that allow “illegal” protests, further escalating his rhetoric targeting US universities.
title: Trump Threatens Funding for Colleges Allowing ‘Illegal’ Protests

description: The Irish government has approved a plan to develop an emergency gas facility, rolling back on its ambitious climate goals in favor of beefing up energy security.
title: Ireland Approves LNG Facility Amid Energy Security Concerns

description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said that he’s ready to work speedily to end Russia’s war on Ukraine, stressing that his dramatic falling out with US President Donald Trump over the path toward peace was “regrettable.”
title: Ukraine’s Zelenskiy Offers Olive Branch to Trump on Peace Deal

description: A global trade war will damage UK growth and drive up inflation even if Donald Trump excludes Britain from the kind of tariffs he is imposing on China, Canada and Mexico, Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves said.
title: Trump’s Tariff War Will Hurt UK and Lift Prices, Reeves Says

description: CK Hutchison Holdings Ltd., the Hong Kong-based conglomerate, agreed to sell control of a unit that operates ports near the Panama Canal after pressure from US President Donald Trump to limit Chinese interests in the region.
title: BlackRock Buys Hutchison’s Panama Ports in Victory for Trump

description: The U.S. Treasury followed through on President Donald Trump’s pledge to stop Chevron Corp. from pumping and selling Venezuelan crude, delivering a major blow to Nicolas Maduro’s autocratic regime.
title: US Gives Chevron One Month to End Operations in Venezuela

description: Tunisia put dozens of people on trial for treason, including prominent opponents of President Kais Saied, ramping up an unprecedented crackdown that’s drawn rebukes from the United Nations.
title: Tunisia Puts Dozens on Trial for Treason in Case Slammed by UN

description: Aviation industry groups and union leaders called on the Federal Aviation Administration to expedite upgrades to critical air-traffic control systems, as Elon Musk pushes SpaceX’s Starlink as a solution for modernization.
title: Aviation Industry Demands Swift Upgrades to Critical FAA Systems

description: Mozambique’s government is in a bind as it comes under pressure from protesters demanding that it tackle high living costs while the International Monetary Fund presses it to rein in spending.
title: Mozambique Struggles to Fulfill IMF Terms and Meet Citizens’ Demands

description: Plans for the biggest deportations in US history threaten to upend the meatpacking industry
title: Cheap US Beef at Risk as Trump Seeks to Deport Haitian Workers

description: Royal Bank of Canada’s Dave McKay said he’s hopeful US tariffs end up being temporary but that it’s disappointing to see the trade war started by President Donald Trump potentially impeding broader economic growth.
title: RBC’s McKay Warns of Hit to Economic Growth From US Tariffs

description: A former Romanian prime minister said he’ll enter a contentious presidential race, potentially jeopardizing an effort to unite behind a single candidate and defeat a far-right frontrunner.
title: Romanian Ex-PM Risks Upending Bid to Block Far-Right Candidate

description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said she’ll announce tariffs and other measures on Sunday in response to US President Donald Trump’s decision to impose levies on goods from her country this week, signaling a souring of relations between long-time trade partners.
title: Mexico’s Sheinbaum to Announce Trump Countermeasures Sunday

description: Israel is giving Hamas “several days” to rethink terms for a new Gaza ceasefire, raising the prospect of further pressure tactics or a resumption of war.
title: Israel Warns Hamas It Has Days to Rethink Ceasefire Position

description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent projected confidence in President Donald Trump’s expansive plans to tariff foreign nations even as the stock market slumped in reaction to the first round of levies on Canada and Mexico.
title: Bessent Shrugs Off Tariff Selloff, Says Wall Street Isn’t Focus

description: Opposition deputies threw smoke grenades in Serbia’s national assembly, disrupting a session set to confirm Prime Minister Milos Vucevic’s resignation and a debate on laws intended to ease months of anti-government protests.
title: Parliament Fight Roils Serbia’s Vucic as Protests Continue

description: Russia agreed to assist US President Donald Trump’s administration in communicating with Iran on issues including the Islamic Republic’s nuclear program and its support for regional anti-US proxies, according to people familiar with the situation.
title: Putin Agrees to Help Trump Broker Nuclear Talks With Iran

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Trump Unites Canadians in Fury Against the US

description: The French government backs extending taxes on the wealthy and aims to mobilize investors amid pressure to boost defense spending as it wrestles with a soaring deficit.
title: France Favors Taxes on Rich Amid Deficit, Defense Pressures

description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez agreed to hand over control of borders and migration to Catalonia’s security forces, in a major win for that region’s separatists.
title: Spain Agrees to Cede Catalan Border Control in Win for Separatists

description: The European Investment Bank will propose expanding its mandate to include projects dedicated for military use, a move that would broaden its investment mandate to include more defense spending.
title: EU Investment Bank to Propose Easing Restrictions for Defense

description: The European Union will propose extending €150 billion ($158 billion) in loans to boost defense spending as the bloc tries to adjust to US President Donald Trump’s abrupt pullback of American security on the continent.
title: EU Proposes €150 Billion Defense Loan as Trump Pulls Back

description: Myanmar’s military chief Min Aung Hlaing met President Vladimir Putin in Moscow on Tuesday as the junta — shunned and sanctioned by the West — turns to a major international backer to aid in its ongoing conflict with ethnic armed groups.
title: Putin and Myanmar’s Junta Chief Set to Deepen Military and Economic Ties

description: China will impose tariffs on a slew of US farm products as part of its countermeasures against Washington, threatening to disrupt a major portion of trade between the two agricultural powerhouses.
title: Trump Tariffs Spark China Retaliation on US Agricultural Exports

description: President Donald Trump delivered on his threat to hit Canada and Mexico with sweeping import levies and doubled an existing charge on China, spurring swift reprisals that plunged the world economy into a deepening trade war.
title: Trump Escalates Global Trade War,  Sparking Tit-for-Tat Tariffs

description: Leaders of Arab countries gathered in Cairo to endorse a Gaza reconstruction plan to counter the controversial ideas of US President Donald Trump, though a number of crucial details need to be ironed out before the proposal is finalized.
title: Arab Leaders to Endorse Gaza Building Plan to Counter Trump

description: Foxconn’s planned mega-AI server plant near Guadalajara, Mexico, will complete construction in a year despite the threat of new tariffs from President Donald Trump, according to Jalisco Governor Pablo Lemus Navarro.
title: Foxconn Mega-AI Plant Ready in a Year Despite Trump Tariffs

description: California Governor Gavin Newsom ordered almost 100,000 state workers to return to their offices four days a week starting in July.
title: California Orders Nearly 100,000 Workers to Return to Office
